result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandin A Ballard

records.addlTxt: State's witness is not present on October 25, 2022 for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Brandin A Ballard appeared in court.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.
Received and Filed: OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report.
Pretrial Services Status (missed scheduled alternate contact) Report

Defendant Brandin A Ballard in court in person. Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel. 
Court reminds defendant to continue to comply with bail conditions: No driving without a valid license. Also conditions of No Contact Order still in effect. 
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Presiding Court Commissioner
Assistant District Attorney
Defendant in court without counsel
Tape No.    Counter No.
Deputy Court Clerk

Defendant Brandin A Ballard in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. States requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AJB and No presence in any Kia or Hyundai unless operated by Def. Ballard's parent.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving during pendency of case.

Defendant Brandin A Ballard in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Brandin A Ballard in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandin A Ballard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
